Policy: Act No. 7 of 2010 on the regulations of nuclear and radioactive activities.
Policy_Content: This Act is composed of 7 parts mainly regulating the nuclear and radioactive activities. Part 1 provides some general provisions. Article 5 prohibits the development, manufacture, possession or transfer, use of nuclear weapons or nuclear explosive devices or offer any assistance to carry out any of these acts. This Act bans the import or export any radioactive waste or nuclear fuel consumed , as well as the dumping of any of it in the sea. Part II sets forth the main duties of the Nuclear Regulatory Commission in handling all the business, supervise, and monitor all functions related to nuclear and radiological activities as well as all licensing issues. Part III provides for the general rules of tenure and trading licenses. Part IV is concerned with nuclear and radioactive emergencies. Part V provides for measures of nuclear security and nuclear safeguards in cases of nuclear damage. Part VI  is concerned with penalties in cases of any violations of the provisions of this act.

Policy: Uttar Pradesh Participatory Irrigation Management Rules, 2010.
Policy_Content: These Rules regulate the water users' association to play their role as effective instruments of participatory irrigation management. The main objective of water users' association is to bring about water users' participation in water management and also to create among the water users' a sense of ownership of irrigation system in their area. More specifically, a water users' association shall: promote and secure equitable, efficient and timely water distribution; motivate water users for adopting practices of scientific and economic use of water; encourage conjunctive use of surface and ground water; encourage intensified and diversified agricultural production system; and protect environment and ecology.

Policy: Agreement between the Federal Service for Hydrometeorology and Environmental Monitoring (ROSHYDROMET) and the Government of Tomsk region on cooperation in the field of hydrometeorology and related fields, environmental monitoring and monitoring of pollution on the regional territory.
Policy_Content: This Agreement defines the intentions of the Parties in the main areas of cooperation between Roshydromet and the Government of Tomsk region on the issues referred to the subjects of joint management of the Russian Federation and the regions of the Russian Federation, requiring concerted action and joint decisions in the framework of works in the field of hydrometeorology and related fields, in the field of state environmental monitoring, improvement of the functioning of an integrated system of observations of the state of the environment in the territory of Tomsk region, assessment and forecast of the state of  changes thereof under the impact of natural and anthropogenic factors. The Agreement is designed to strengthen cooperation between the Parties in the field of state environmental monitoring, adoption and implementation of target programs and planned environmental protection activities, providing the population and regional executive bodies with information on the state of the environment and its pollution. The main areas and forms of interaction between the Parties shall be as follows: (a) ensuring the functioning and improvement of the state observation network and territorial system of observations of the state of the environment and its pollution in the regional territory; (b) improving the efficiency of forecasting of natural disasters, phenomena and creation of optimal conditions for the improvement of the level of protection of the population and reduction of damage caused by natural disasters; (c) improvement of early warning system for the population related to dangerous natural phenomena and actual and projected changes in weather and environmental pollution, which may threaten the life and health of the population and cause damage to the environment; and (d) planning and implementation of joint programs and activities in the fields of interaction, exchange of information, working meetings and conferences on the most important issues requiring joint solutions in the of state environmental monitoring and environmental pollution on the territory of Tomsk region.
Subject: Air & atmosphere, Environment gen.

La presente norma es aplicable a todas las personas naturales y jurídicas, administradores portuarios y representantes de las naves que prestan el servicio de recojo de residuos en las zonas portuarias. Para efectos de su aplicación, se entenderá por: 1) Recojo de Residuos: aquel servicio por el cual a través de medios mecánicos se procede al acopio de los materiales de desechos líquidos (oleosos) o sólidos que provienen de la operación ordinaria de una embarcación; 2) Recolector: la persona natural o jurídica con licencia otorgada por la Autoridad Portuaria competente para recoger los residuos de una nave; 3) Generador: la nave que genera y entrega los residuos al recolector. Queda prohibida la descarga de residuos líquidos cuando la nave está realizando operaciones de carga y/o descarga de mercancías peligrosas.

Policy: Biosafety Act No. 5977.
Policy_Content: The aim of this Act is to establish a biosafety system to prevent and reduce the risks that resulting from biotechnology, genetically modified organisms and products to protect human, animal and plant health, to protect the environment and biological diversity; and to ensure sustainability. The Act sets forth the rules and procedures on the establishement and implementation of a biosafety system. It covers provisions on research, improvement, processing, use, transfer, storage, packeging and labelling, import and export of genetically modified organisms and products. The Act further encloses provisions on risk assesment, risk management and defines the powers and duties of the Ministry of Food Agriculture and Livestock, the responsible committee and its duties. Policy: Decree No. 32/20 of the Ministry of Public Health validating Sanitary and veterinary rules “Impact of brucellosis on human environment due to microbiological factors”.
Policy_Content: This Decree validates Sanitary and veterinary rules “Impact of brucellosis on human environment due to microbiological factors”. It establishes that the main sources of infection of brucellosis for human beings are sheep, goat, cattle and swine. Brucellosis shall be classified as infectious disease common to animals and human beings. Brucella shall be classified as pathogenic microorganism. Owners (farmers, lessees) of agricultural animals shall be responsible for the observance of sanitary and veterinary rules and regulations related to animal health and shall have the following duties: (a) to register animals by the local veterinary service unit; (b) to perform trade, slaughtering, grazing and transportation with prior authorization of veterinary service; (c) to put in quarantine for 30 days newly arrived animals; and (d) to inform the local veterinary unit of all suspected cases of brucellosis.
Subject: Livestock, Environment gen.
Geographical_area: CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA

Policy: Decree No. 31/21 of the Ministry of Public Health validating Sanitary and veterinary rules “Prophylaxis and liquidation of tuberculosis, disease common to animals and human beings”.
Policy_Content: This Decree validates Sanitary and veterinary rules “Prophylaxis and liquidation of tuberculosis, disease common to animals and human beings”. Tuberculosis is chronic infectious disease common to animals, poultry (birds) and human beings. Local government shall impose quarantine on territories worst affected by tuberculosis and shall be applicable anti-tuberculosis arrangements. Sanitary arrangements shall be carried out by means of the systematic diagnostic research, simultaneous substitution of the livestock of the infected farm, express bringing into a healthy state (in case of the marginal spreading of the disease). The principal method of ante mortem diagnostics of tuberculosis shall be intracutaneous tuberculin test. In order to perform thereof clean tuberculin shall be used for mammals and poultry.
Subject: Livestock, Environment gen.
Geographical_area: CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA

A tal fin se establece una Comisión especial (art. 8). El objetivo es armonizar la relación entre los distintos participantes de los proyectos en este sector, además de ser instrumento de promoción de desarrollo sustentable, garantizando la protección y preservación del medio ambiente y el logro de la eficiencia y diversificación energética en el Estado de Oaxaca. La Ley contempla el otorgamiento de incentivos y beneficios para fomentar la investigación científica y tecnológica en esta materia, con especial atención al desarrollo de la energía solar, eólica, hidráulica y de la biomasa.

Policy: Styria Land Use Planning Law 2010.

Policy_Content: Mediante la presente Ley se establecen disposiciones para promover el desarrollo agroeconómico de la Región Central de Puerto Rico (cuyos municipios integrantes se enumeran en el artículo 2º). Son objetivos primordiales promocionar el desarrollo agroeconómico, respaldar a los gobiernos municipales en lo que concierne a la región de la montaña, y proveer los recursos necesarios para hacer viable un crecimiento económico sustentable y cónsono con las capacidades de esta región. Policy: Décret N° 2010-137 du 23 mars 2010 portant réglementation de la gestion intégrée des zones côtières et marines de Madagascar.
Policy_Content: Le présent décret a pour objet la mise en œuvre de la politique de développement durable et de la stratégie nationale de gestion intégrée des zones côtières (GIZC) de Madagascar délimitées comme suit: - côté terre, l’ensemble des communes côtières, districts côtiers, des 13 Régions littorales, et tous les espaces définis par les Bassins Versants, fortes pentes;  - côté mer, l’ensemble du plateau continental dans la limite de la Zone Economique Exclusive de Madagascar, en conformité avec sa ratification de la Convention des Nations Unies sur le Droit de la Mer (UNCLOS);  - la partie de l’atmosphère se trouvant au-dessus de la partie marine et terrestre de Madagascar.

Policy: Action Plan for National Recovery and Development of Haiti 2010-2015.
Policy_Content: This Sectoral Action Plan for National Recovery and Development is the country’s long-term vision for development 2010-2030. It is based on four major areas of work for rebuilding of Haiti. The sectoral actions are brought together according to the themes of regional, economic, social and institutional reconstruction. The specific action plans for each field are organised in the following way: Territorial reconstruction of devastated areas and urban infrastructures, preparation for the hurricane season, regional planning and local development under the control of the Haitian Interim Reconstruction Commission (HIRC). Economic re-launch of national production, access to electricity. Social sector (health, food safety, nutrition, water and sanitation). Democratic institutional rebuilding, justice and security (pag. 10). Section 4(3.6) deals with healthcare, food security/nutrition, water and sanitation. The government is planning to implement a safety net directed at vulnerable households living in food insecurity in the areas affected by the earthquake, in particular for children under five and pregnant or breast-feeding women benefit from food supplies (pag. 38).

Policy: Uganda Strategic Investment Framework for Sustainable Land Management 2010 - 2020.
Policy_Content: The overall goal of the Uganda Strategic Investment Framework for Sustainable Land Management 2010 - 2020 (U-SIF SLM) is to ensure that key sectors are cooperating to improve natural resources based livelihoods and other ecosystem services. The U-SLM SIF focuses on: 1) Supporting on-the-ground activities for scaling up SLM; 2) Strengthening the enabling institutional and policy environment for SLM; 3) Strengthening commercial and advisory services for SLM and alternative livelihood options; and 4) Supporting SLM research and dissemination of best-bet technologies to improve the needed technological capacity in an integrated and participatory approach. Policy: Mineral Policy of Liberia.
Policy_Content: This Mineral Policy is a nationwide sectoral document aiming at giving adequate indications to the investment community (both national and foreign) of a competitive mineral regime that is informed by international trends, adheres to international norms, is grounded in local conditions and is accountable to national common interests in order to realize the following Vision statement for the mining sector "Equitable and optimal exploitation of Liberia’s mineral resources to underpin broad-based sustainable growth and socio-economic development". The main strategies of the current Government are to revive the mineral sector to enhance its contribution to government revenues, foreign exchange earnings, employment creation, ancillary economic activities, human resources and technology development and the improvement of social and physical infrastructure. To achieve these strategies, the Government has the following objectives (i) establish an internationally competitive and stable business climate to attract and sustain foreign and local investment; (ii) formulate a fiscal and concession scheme that assures the country of fair value for its resources, while offering equitable rewards to private investors; (iii) institutionalize procedures to maximize returns to the nation; (iv) put in place a mechanism for the evaluation of competing land use options; (v) eliminate adverse social conditions and environmental degradation due to mining activities; (vi) support and enable artisanal and small scale mining activities to create employment, generate income and help reduce poverty in the rural areas; (vii) ensure equitable distribution of benefits from mining activities; (viii) facilitate equitable access to the sector, irrespective of gender or ethnicity; (ix) ensure consultation of all stakeholders and protect affected people from exploration through mining and post-mine closure; and (x) establish an effective administration and management of the mineral sector.

Policy: Guide for Mainstreaming Gender in the Agricultural Sector.
Policy_Content: This guide is made on the understanding of the negative impacts of gender inequalities on families and the larger economy; there is empirical evidence that gender inequality is both an economic and social issue and that greater gender equality could be a potent force for accelerated poverty reduction in Africa. Kenya’s agricultural sector is characterized by gender inequalities which hurt the performance of the sector. The guide identifies that the gender concerns transcend the different areas of the agricultural sector and attempts to address at all levels including institutions, programs and households. The approach suggested by the guide is based on four pillars; a political will, technical capacity, accountability and organizational culture. Political will reflects the way in which leaders use their position of power to communicate and demonstrate their support towards gender equality. Technical capacity is about the ability, qualifications and skills of individuals in the practical aspects of gender integration. Accountability is about the mechanisms by which an organization determines the extent to which it is actively integrating gender equality in its programs. Organizational culture addresses norms, beliefs and codes of behaviour in an organization that supports or undermines gender equality. The plan advocates the use of existing gender analysis tools by program teams and communities in engendering programs and projects; the use of gender sensitive monitoring and evaluation to unravel the extent to which a project has addressed the needs of men and women and has made impact on their lives and overall social and economic wellbeing.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Africa, AFRICA FAO, Eastern Africa

Policy: Environment Sector Strategy 2011-2013.
Policy_Content: This Environment Sector Strategy is a nationwide sectoral document, the second one, after the e Palestinian Environment Strategy of 1999. The Vision of the environment sector was conceived as follows: “A Palestinian environment that is protected, maintained and safe and that achieves sustainability of natural resources to respond to the current needs of the Palestinian society while ensuring the rights of future generations to enjoy a healthy and safe environment as well as social welfare under an independent Palestinian sovereignty”. Six priorities and objectives were identified for the Environment Sector Strategy that would serve for this 4-year period and extend to the long run. These are (i) a Palestinian environment that is clean, safe, and pollution-free; (ii) natural environment and cultural heritage are preserved and maintained; (iii) Palestinian natural resources are managed sustainably; (iv) all measures required to cope with climate change, combat desertification and confront environmental and natural disasters are taken; (v) the institutional and legal environmental framework is strong, effective and working in an integrated and concerted manner; and (vi) the State of Palestine is committed to international conventions and treaties on the environment.

Policy: Regulation on conditions that must be met by users of funds from the Environmental Protection Fund of the Federation of Bosnia and Herzegovina.
Policy_Content: This Regulation, based on the provisions of the Law on environmental protection fund and of the Statute of the environmental protection fund of the Federation of Bosnia and Herzegovina, prescribes the conditions that must be met by all users of funds of the Environmental Protection Fund of the Federation of Bosnia and Herzegovina. Beneficiaries of Fund's assets can be legal and natural persons who invest funds in programmes, projects and similar activities in the field of conservation, sustainable use, protection and improvement of the environment. Legal entities are bodies and authorities of state administrations, local self-government units and entities registered within the competent court, i.e. competent administrative bodies for performing activities from areas of the environment. Natural persons are persons which are registered within the competent administrative body for performing activities from environmental related sectors or areas. The Fund's resources are used to finance environmental protection, in particular: protection, preservation and improvement of air, soil, water and sea quality, and climate change mitigation and protection of the ozone layer; remediation, encouragement of waste avoidance and reduction; exploitation of valuable properties and waste treatment; protection and preservation of biological and landscape diversity; implementation of energy programmes; demining programmes; improvement and construction of infrastructure for environmental protection; improving the monitoring and assessment of the state of the environment, and introduction of the system for environmental management; encouraging the sustainable use of natural resources; encouraging sustainable economic activities, i.e. sustainable economic development; encouraging research, development studies, programmes, projects and other activities, including demonstration activities.

Policy_Content: La presente Norma Oficial Mexicana tiene como finalidad establecer las especificaciones que debe cumplir el gas natural que se maneje en los sistemas de transporte, almacenamiento y distribución de gas natural, para preservar la seguridad de las personas, medio ambiente e instalaciones de los permisionarios y de los usuarios. Estas disposiciones se aplican al gas natural que se entrega en cada uno de los puntos de inyección a los sistemas de transporte, almacenamiento y distribución, así como en cada uno de los puntos de transferencia de custodia a otros permisionarios o usuarios finales. La Norma en cambio no se aplica al gas natural que se conduce desde pozos y complejos procesadores, ni al gas natural licuado que se transporta por buques tanque a las terminales de almacenamiento de gas natural licuado, ni al gas natural licuado y el gas natural que se maneja en dichas terminales previamente a su inyección al sistema de transporte.

Policy: Act on the air.
Policy_Content: This Act is composed of the following Sections: General provisions (Sec. 1); Air quality (Sec. 2); Obligations of persons (Sec. 3); Air protection organs and their competences (Sec. 4); Transitional, enabling and final provisions (Sec. 5). This Act establishes: (a) aim of the air quality, air quality assessment and public information on air quality; (b) rights and obligations of persons relating to protection of the air against polluting substances deriving from human activities and concerning reducing reasons and limiting effects of air pollution; (c) certification of competences and obligations of authorized operators concerning drawing up expertise; (d) authorized measurement, calibration, testing and inspection; (e) competences of state administration organs of air protection; (f) liability for violating obligations relating to air protection. The aim of the air quality is to preserve air quality in areas where air quality is good, and to improve air quality in other areas.

Policy: Spatial Information Infrastructure Act.

Policy: Heritage Conservation Act (S.N.B. 2009, c. H-4.05).
Policy_Content: The present Act lays down provisions relating to the cultural heritage in the province of New Brunswick. The Act strengthen the province’s ability to conserve heritage sites and objects by establishing the Crown as legal owner of heritage objects, and prohibiting the alteration of heritage sites. Furthermore, the Act improves the existing process of designating heritage places, including providing opportunities for public input, establishing a means for the public to nominate places having provincial significance, and establishing linkages to the provincial land registry for sites that are designated. Fines for non-compliance with heritage conservation laws are increased, making them comparable with those in other jurisdictions in Canada; expanding the scope of municipal-heritage authority to create bylaws, and giving municipalities more flexibility to tailor bylaws to community interests. The text – consisting of 121 sections deals with the following aspects: archaeology, palaeontology and alteration. provincial heritage of sites, municipal heritage, appeals, enforcement, general provisions and regulations, transitional provisions, consequential amendments, repeal and commencement

Policy: Governmental Decree No. 96 validating the Regulation on anti-corruption expert evaluation of normative legal acts and draft normative regulatory acts.
Policy_Content: This Regulation establishes the procedure for conducting an anti-corruption expert examination of normative legal acts and draft normative legal acts by the Ministry of Justice of the Russian Federation and an independent anti-corruption expert examination of normative legal acts and draft normative legal acts in order to identify corruption factors in them and their subsequent elimination. The Ministry of Justice of the Russian Federation conducts an anti-corruption expert evaluation in accordance with the methodology for conducting an anti-corruption expert evaluation of normative legal acts and draft normative legal acts with respect to (a) draft federal laws, draft decrees of the President of the Russian Federation and draft resolutions of the Government of the Russian Federation developed by federal executive authorities, other government agencies and organizations - when conducting their legal expert review; (b) draft amendments of the Government of the Russian Federation to draft federal laws prepared by federal executive authorities and other state agencies and organizations - in the course of their legal review; (c) normative legal acts of federal executive authorities, other state bodies and organizations affecting the rights, freedoms and obligations of man and citizen, establishing the legal status of organizations or having interdepartmental character, as well as status of municipalities and municipal legal acts on amending statutes of municipalities - during their state registration; and (d) normative legal acts of constituent entities (regions) of the Russian Federation - when monitoring their application and entering information in the federal register of normative legal acts of constituent entities of the Russian Federation. The results of an anti-corruption expert review are reflected in the conclusion of the Ministry of Justice of the Russian Federation on the results of a legal expert review or in the conclusion of the Ministry of Justice of the Russian Federation in accordance with the form approved by the Ministry.

Policy: Regional Law No. 7-OZ “On ensuring fertility of agricultural land”.
Policy_Content: The scope of this Regional Law shall be to ensure fertility of agricultural land by owners, landlords, land tenants and leaseholders. This Regional Law shall not be applicable to land plots allotted to citizens for personal subsidiary farming, gardening, horticulture and animal husbandry. The main arrangements for ensuring soil fertility shall be: (a) elaboration and realization of regional programs; (b) soil, agrochemical, phytosanitary, ecological and toxicological inspection; (c) investments in soil conservation and reproduction; and (d) improvement of soil quality and fertility. Owners, tenants and leaseholders of agricultural land must: (a) prevent soil pollution, littering and degradation; (b) carry out agricultural production by methods ensuring reproduction of soil fertility and preventing negative environmental impact; (c) inform authorized institutions of soil pollution and degradation of agricultural land; and (d) not apply ecologically hazardous fertilizers, ameliorators and pesticides.Possessors, owners, users, including tenants, of land plots shall have the right to perform agro-technical, agrochemical, land reclamation, phytosanitary and anti-erosion reproductive measures for restoration of agricultural land fertility; receive information from executive bodies of the regional authorities in accordance with the established procedure related to the state of soil fertility on their land and the dynamics of its condition.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development, Land & soil
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Crown Land Management Regulations 2010.

Policy: Ministerial Decree No. 97 validating the Regulation on subsidies for credits allocated by financial institutions to agricultural enterprises for lease of machinery.
Policy_Content: This Ministerial Decree establishes the rules for allocation of subsidies to agricultural enterprises processing agicultural commodities as compensation of credits on lease of agricultural machinery and raw agricultural commodities subject to subsequent processing. In particular state subsidies shall be destined for compensation of credits allocated for purchase of meat, poultry, eggs, milk, berries, vegetables, fish, and flour for manufacturing of finished products, infant food and canned foods. Financial institutions shall allocate credits in accordance with the following criteria: (a) resident in the Republic of Kazakhstan; (b) absence of arrears related to taxes and pension contributions for more than three months; and (c) purchase of agricultural raw materials, destined for subsequent processing, from national producers, except for agricultural raw products that are not available from national producers. Subsidies from state budget shall not exceed 80 percent of credit.
Subject: Agricultural & rural development
Geographical_area: Aral Sea, Caspian Sea, Central Asia, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, Landlocked Developing Countries, North Asia
